thread.title: Absurd Things About 401(k) Plans That Are True
thread.title_full: Absurd Things About 401(k) Plans That Are True

author: Ary Rosenbaum
title: Absurd Things About 401(k) Plans That Are True
text:
Absurd Things About 401(k) Plans That Are True more+ Contact 
To embed, copy and paste the code into your website or blog: <iframe src="http://www.jdsupra.com/post/contentViewerEmbed.aspx?fid=1236eaa5-df8e-454b-8f7f-98f5913b58d7" width="100%" height="620" frameborder="1" style="border: 2px solid #ccc; overflow-x:hidden !important; overflow:hidden;" scrolling="auto"></iframe> 
We drive on parkways and park on driveways. Cigarettes are sold in gas stations even though smoking is prohibited there. Fat chance and slim chance mean the same thing. Phonetic isn’t spelled the way it sounds. When it comes to retirement plans, there are absurd things that make no sense, but are actually true. The problem is that a plan sponsors don’t know about these things before it’s too late. So this article is about absurd things about 401(k) plans that are actually true.
